message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The drug aims to inhibit bronchoconstriction by inhibiting acetylcholine binding to muscarinic receptors. Among the options, only Ipratropium is an anticholinergic drug that works by blocking muscarinic receptor activation. Cromolyn and Zafirlukast work by inhibiting inflammation while Prednisone is a corticosteroid that regulates the immune system.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bronchoconstriction is caused by acetylcholine binding to muscarinic receptors in the airway smooth muscle. Ipratropium is an antimuscarinic drug that inhibits this binding, resulting in bronchodilation. Cromolyn, Zafirlukast, and Prednisone are all used to treat asthma via different mechanisms, but none of them directly inhibit the binding of acetylcholine to muscarinic receptors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Acetylcholine is involved in bronchoconstriction, and muscarinic receptors are a type of receptor that acetylcholine binds to. Inhibiting acetylcholine binding to muscarinic receptors can help to reduce bronchoconstriction. Among the options, only Ipratropium works by blocking muscarinic receptors. Cromolyn does not affect muscarinic receptors, Zafirlukast works on leukotrienes, and Prednisone is a corticosteroid and has an anti-inflammatory effect.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bronchoconstriction is caused by acetylcholine binding to muscarinic receptors, and inhibiting this binding is the mechanism of action of Ipratropium. Therefore, the new drug is most similar to Ipratropium. Cromolyn works by stabilizing mast cells and preventing release of inflammatory mediators, Zafirlukast is a leukotriene receptor antagonist, and Prednisone is a steroid used for its anti-inflammatory effects.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Acetylcholine is a neurotransmitter that causes bronchoconstriction. Muscarinic receptors are the target receptors for acetylcholine in the bronchi. Inhibiting acetylcholine binding to muscarinic receptors can prevent bronchoconstriction, which is the mechanism of action for Ipratropium. Cromolyn works by inhibiting mast cell degranulation, while Zafirlukast is a leukotriene receptor antagonist, and Prednisone is a corticosteroid.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The drug that inhibits bronchoconstriction by inhibiting acetylcholine binding to muscarinic receptors is most similar to Ipratropium, which is an anticholinergic drug used to treat asthma. Cromolyn and Zafirlukast are mast cell stabilizers and leukotriene inhibitors, respectively, while Prednisone is a corticosteroid used to reduce inflammation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The drug's mechanism of inhibiting bronchoconstriction by reducing acetylcholine binding to muscarinic receptors is similar to that of Ipratropium. Cromolyn works by stabilizing mast cells and preventing inflammation but does not inhibit bronchoconstriction. Zafirlukast is a leukotriene receptor antagonist, and Prednisone is a corticosteroid that reduces inflammation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Acetylcholine binding to muscarinic receptors leads to bronchoconstriction, so inhibiting this binding will reduce bronchoconstriction. Ipratropium is an inhaled medication that acts as a muscarinic antagonist, similar to the mechanism of action described in the experimental assays. Cromolyn, Zafirlukast, and Prednisone work through different mechanisms and are not related to muscarinic receptors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The drug inhibits bronchoconstriction, which suggests it targets muscarinic receptors. Among the options, only Ipratropium is an anticholinergic drug that targets muscarinic receptors. Cromolyn targets mast cells, Zafirlukast targets leukotriene receptors, and Prednisone is a steroid that reduces inflammation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Bronchoconstriction is caused by the activity of parasympathetic nerves on muscarinic receptors. Inhibiting muscarinic receptors will reduce bronchoconstriction. Among the options, only Ipratropium is an antimuscarinic drug used to treat asthma. Cromolyn inhibits mast cell degranulation, Zafirlukast is a leukotriene receptor antagonist, and Prednisone is a corticosteroid.
